name: Gabe The Dark Knight v3.0
description: CREATED BY @ANDYJONESTWEETS

name: Door, meet Boot.exe
Mind Over Matter
description: I've never built fast-advance before and I'm looking for feedback. I didn't want totally wimpy ICE like Paper Wall and Quandary, but most of the ICE costs 5 or less to rez and I think I have enough econ to support everything, but again I've never built fast advance before.

name: HB Single Core Test
description: I used the original version and tried to add some upgrades to make a 49 cards deck.

name: Swank's Core Set Demo Deck (Runner)
description: A deck I use to show Netrunner to new players. Based on the core set Shaper cards with some Criminal thrown in to even things out (Desperado, Ninja) and add some surprises (Femme Fatale, Sneakdoor Beta).

name: Swank's Core Set Demo Deck (Corp)
description: A deck I use to show Netrunner to new players. Used the base Weyland deck for the good ice and economy cards. Splashed some ambushes from Jinteki to demonstrate the bluffing and mind games aspect of the game.

name: Get'r Dun v2
description:
This deck is to gear check the runner and block him from having any successful runs. Power Shutdown, Archer, and Grim remove programs and every other piece of ice ends the run.

There is actually a nice fast advance system built in if you can get some extra clicks on a Project Atlas. Trick of Light can be used recursively with Jackson Howard and Project Atlas tokens. Ideally, you are advancing ice every turn. For Commercialization and Trick of Light.

My initial thought is to leave the bad pub there as they shouldn't have the gear to break the ice, so the bad publicity credits don't matter. I've found that if they do land a breaker with a bunch of bad publicity, then they can eat your lunch and since the economy is agenda driven, once, it gets away from you, it can be hard to recover. Veterans Program is also food for Archer which opens up more options if I don't score a Hostile Takeover right away.

name: Getting it Done.
description:
Bury or trash their frackers to open up scoring windows. Veterans Program is to keep the Bad Publicity reasonable and feed Archer.

Archived Memories is to bring back whatever I need to get rid of their Frackers. Jackson Howardis the stop Power Shutdown from losing me the game and additional recursion. Wraparound is to stop AI breakers from eating my lunch.

name: KitBox V1.0
description:
This is my first time building a deck, so forgive me if there are glaring holes in it. This deck aims to tutor programs using SMC and Testrun + scavenge to install ice cheaply from stand and/or heap. On the offensive side, Yog.O'saurus combined with paintbrush to get past through any rezzed ice, Kit's passive also help in this deck, where first ice encountered during my turn becomes code gate.

Any feedback is appreciated =D

name: A deck made by someone not popular and who didn't won a tour
description:
Full name: A deck made by someone not popular and who didn't won a tournament but still find his idea is good enough to share (AKA The Impossible Fortress).

Now that I got your attention, here is the idea I wanted to share which mainly revolve around: Caprice Nisei + Off The Grid + Crisium Grid + Advancable ICE.

Yeah that's right, It's all about creating a gigantic HQ server protected by Caprice/Crisium and going for the long run.

I came to this idea because I was trying to make the best use of the BwBi ID and it's really difficult to protect multiple server while advancing ICE each turn to make them worthy.

A big part of the idea is to focus on Barrier. Mainly because most of the best advancing ICE is Barrier. A good synergy to point out is Hive and Superior Cyberwalls. The only agenda that won't hurt its taxing ability.

Still, Hive should be mainly for R&D, or a least one of them, and here's why: By the time you start scoring agenda on a OtG remote, your hands should have plenty of agenda. So R&D will start to matters less.

A early remote is favorable if you have scoring window. Even more if it's to score Superior Cyberwalls to generate money and taxing power.

The deck is in a primitive form right now but still the core idea is interesting and really hard to stop when triggered.

I put the deck down so people can bring thought about it or start developing new idea.

So, what do you think guys?

name: PORTALS! v2
description: Needs moar Cell Portal

name: Weyland Runner Hunters
description:
First time making a deck from scratch so probably doesn't make any sense. Been playing with netdecks for a while and wanted to just find something I think is actually fun and go for it, namely making a corporation who's sole job is to hunt and kill runners >:]

Let me know what you think!

name: The Return of the Bioroid Army 2.0
description:
This deck is my second try in building something that aims to make very click-expensive every runs on remote servers.

TSB introduced 2 cards that work well with strong Bioroid ICEs: #Heinlein Grid and #ELP. They have a lot of synergy with #Ruhr Valley and #Strongbox. #Awakening Center, BER and OAI for some economy and rezzing big ICE in the early game. #Eden Fragment to help building a "glacier" server. #Mutate: why not? Turning and #Ichi 1.0 into a #Janus for 2 credits seems fun.

Comments are welcome.

UPDATE:

+3 #Adonis Campaign -1 #Mutate -2 #Will-o-the-Wisp

name: Tag, Bag & Fast Advance v2.0
description: a new approach for the deck the idea been that you get a Midseason's off on the runner then either kill them with scorched or Score out Vitruvius with a counter to rinse repeat. and along the way accumulate any brain damage you can to help the Scorched win.

name: Lucky Lady v.1
description: This is a deck my friend has been playing and doing pretty well. For whatever reason it seems to be a faster build for a shaper then normal.This is probably due to him hosting self modifying code on the leprechaun and then tutoring for what he needs. Our meta is really just three people but everything we build can't stop him. It seems more like an all around deck then a really focused deck but it works and I wanted to share it with you guys see what you thought.

name: Angers
Gotta Keep Running - Criminal
description: A deck that hopes to profit from continually running, and slowly breaking the corp down.

name: psynteki
SlySquid's Pawnshop v3.1
description: This is it I think! Had to go back to Wyrm, I didn't have it and I'm so use to playing with it... I know a lot of people hate on it but it's really REALLY strong against low ice and brutal when paired with Parasite... Also any extra copy's can be Aesop's Pawnshoped out for cash!

name: NoiseTest
description:
I am not a fan of using Wyldside. I don't like depending on having both it and Aesop's Pawnshop in play for a workable draw engine. As a result i decided to go with 2x Diesel and 2x QT to help ramp through my deck. Same Old Thing does double work here. Not only does SOT help with using additional Deja Vu's, but in a pinch i can lose 2 clicks to use a Quality Time or Diesel. Sort of a "mini" version of Duggers.

Aesop's Pawnshop was a card I thought had to go along with Wyldside, but after throwing away large numbers of Cache and Imp, I decided to keep them in for the economy gained. I may drop the number of them down to 2 or 1 and then use the influence on Special Order, Mr. Li, or Hostage and add in a Kati Jones. More testing needs to be done before i make that decision.

Aesop's also has the added benefit of making Daily Casts a much better card. Slow burn to 6, then trash it for 3 can be a big leap when combined with the economy gained from Cache. The additional of Daily Cast (and the fact that its a neutral card) make the inclusion of it over Cyberfeeder and Sahasrara seem like a much better option.

I went with fixies because I'm a bitch. =/ I haven't tested with Darwin or ONLY Crypsis, So currently this is where the most testing is being done. As odd as it sounds, I have considered making the influence of a 1x Levy AR Lab Access. This throws the viruses back in the deck and helps vs the Jinteki Matchup.

I was considering Sahasrara or Cyberfeeder, but i

name: Weyland Killer
description: This is a fairly standard Super Modern deck all about releasing the taint, the GRNDL, the fleshy funbundle. I used Will-o'-the-Wisp to punish the runner for hitting a central or to laugh as they crawl through my super server only to find it. Primary win cons are using Jackson Howard to dig like mad for the SEA Scorched or putting a few extra points on an Atlas to find it as needed. Another option is scoring False Lead and using it to pressure the runner away from hitting things outside of their first click, if the run into a snare click two and you've got double schorched it's pretty much over if that's out. I'm not sure if there's a better agenda to use then The Cleaners, but scoring it before you scorch them can help chew through those plascretes.

name: Andy Pressure
description:
Andromeda's amazing card draw at the beginning of the game can help shut your opponent down early and fast. Ideally you want to get a Desperado, Dirty Laundry,Account Siphon, and a Special Order, or ice breaker in your starting hand. I've noticed that when playing people they almost always expect you to run Faerie so they don't drop sentries in front of their HQ turn one if given no other option, but with a Special Order and a turn one Infiltration on their HQ ice it can be pretty easy to break into their HQ turn two and begin draining their cash.

My only current worry about this deck is a lack of graveyard interaction as one good brain/net/meat damage could kill one of my breakers and have it be game over. So as of now playing breakers is priority number one.

name: Dec@Day.06 - The Art Thief
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

Ever since seeing Silencer, I've wanted to see Kate become the type to sneak attack some ICE. We're getting more Stealth breakers in a bit, but Dagger is a Killer--and one of the best in the business.

Between Cloak, Silencer, and Ghost Runner, we can get our Stealth credits online fast and start face-checking with confidence. Once we get some recurring credits with Cyberfeeder, Net Celebrity and an eventual Toolbox, we can threaten at least one run a turn for free. While we have a Decoder and a Fracter just in case we need them, Paintbrush and Tinkering helps ensure the ICE we meet is our favorite type: the cheap-to-break-with-Dagger kind.

Leprechaun helps host our Paintbrush or Magnum Opus, and Parasite (especially with Clone Chip) helps clear out those annoying low-strength ICE. Finally, R&D Interface and Eden Shard help us with those final digs to find the game-winning Agenda points.

Suggestions, critiques or comments? Feel free--the entire reason I'm doing this is to build my deckbuilding skills. Tomorrow finishes out the Core Set Identities with "Good" Guy Weyland.

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles
  • 04 Cr: Gabe - By Hook or By Crook
  • 05 NBN: MN - Watching Out for You

name: The Return of the Bioroid Army 2.1
description: Modified version of TRBA 2.0. Thanks all for the suggestions!

name: The Key To Your Cards - MK. 7
description: Credit to LeonardQuirm

name: Luxury Toybox
description: This is stupid. Probably. Inspired by my previous foundry deck, but with Eliza's Toybox and all expensive ice.

name: "We Provide... Leverage."
description:
It was the heist of the century, and she couldn't resist.

But first, she needed a crew...

  1. The Compromised Employee: Andromeda knew some Corp employees who could be persuaded to look the other way for a couple minutes.
  2. The Data Dealer: Andy has connections in ChiLo who could take the info and turn it around for the payday of all paydays.
  3. The Fall Guy: She'd heard of some loud-mouth chummer who was planning a big run at the same time. "Honor among thieves my ass," she thought as she prepared evidence to plant.
  4. John Masanori: This guy was hot shit and they both knew it. "I can watch the connections for ya, Andy. Make sure NAPD gets distracted and whatnot." She sighed. "What percent cut?" He grinned and smugly said, "Not a credit under 20%."
  5. Kati Jones: The most experienced driver Andy knew. She knew Kati had a bone to pick with the Corps.
  6. Mr. Li: Andy needed some additional data and gear. Mr. Li had everything a girl could ask for.
  7. The Other Contacts: Both professional and underworld, Andy knew people in various social groups who would hop on the bandwagon for a piece of the pie.

After weeks of planning, Andy's crew was finally ready...

I was inspired to build this deck from the various heist movies out there and Andromeda was the only runner I could imagine for the job. There's plenty of money and draw power to be had here. I don't like having Plascretes in my decks so with this one I went for max hand size since Andy can definitely make good use of it early game. ICEbreakers were a tough choice since I needed influence elsewhere but I'm pretty happy overall with the amount I have and they should be fairly cheap to use too. The deck takes some planning to set up (like most every heist) but by the end you should have a clean getaway with some Corp agendas.

name: Schehexually Transmitted Diseases: The Second Strain
description: The original Schehexually Transmitted Diseases gets a little bit of an upgrade with more 1 cost viruses (and Cache 'cause...duh) and teh back up of two Demo Runs. I've found in the original that Corps are getting a bit faster so spending a few clicks on a full aggressive R&D push (will be easy to get the Mediums out) if the non-running thing isn't working out. Slightly higher success rate. :)

name: Divergent Destinies 0.01
description: Corp Deck I ran with today

name: Global Warming 0.01
description: Noise Deck for today

name: Magical Nasir 9.4.14
description: 9.4.14. Some updates to my Magical Nasir build that draws from HallucinogenicApplesauce's Magical Kate deck back in June.

name: No chute
description:
I want to break ice. I have one of each ice subtype paired with Magnum Opus to pay for breaking glaciers. Crypsis is for ice the two Personal Touches can't help touch, and an Ice Carver for overall help. Self-modifying code will help me find what I need, and Tinkering will help my early runs. Since I only have one of each breaker, Sacrificial Constructs will help protect them, as well as having one Deja Vu and one Levy Access, just in case.

Until I get Magnum running I think I have good economy cards. My console and one Cyberfeeder help reduce what I pay out of my own pocket. Once again, saving money to break through glaciers.

Indexing, R&D Interface, Maker's Eye, and Deep Thought help me R&D lock against fast advance decks. Sneakdoor Beta opens up HQ twice in case my R&D lock works and I hit a dry patch of no agendas.

As far as defense against damage goes, that's why this deck is called No Chute. I have none. I want to fire on all cylinders. I think I am.

name: HB: ST - Do Bioroids Dream of Cybernetic Goats?
description:
Has HB:ST's time come? It's yet to be seen. But new toys recently released have certainly helped playing it more fun.

Ice Placement: The name of the game is tax, tax, tax, and more tax. Surviving the early game is critical here. Against fast aggressive runners, you will want to get your ice set up ASAP in order make each run as expensive as possible. While your ice is porous, it is very taxing. Since there are only 8 agendas in the deck, the chances of them pulling an early Agenda are low, but it can certainly happen. Against criminals running Security Testing and Sneak Door Beta, that means you cannot leave a single remote or central server without ice. Icing Archives also becomes necessary when playing against Parasite & Datasucker combos.

An ideal central server ice placement starting from outside to in is: Ichi 1.0 - Victor 1.0 - Eli 1.0. These three ice will form the core of your central servers. This is fairly cheap for you to rez throughout the game and will continue to tax the runner significantly all game. Against potential Account Siphon users, you want ice at least two deep on HQ as soon as possible. Against runners who have run-based economy (Gabe, Desperado, Security Testing), mid-to-late game actually becomes better for you because if you've set up your servers properly, they should not be earning any money per run, starving them of money.

Celebrity Gift: A true MVP in this deck. It gives HB:ST the quick cash injection that it so badly needs, especially having to give up the powerful 1 free credit per install that HB:EtF enjoys. While Melange Mining fulfills largely the same role, it has the huge downside of needing to be protected for a turn. Since there are no tricks or mind games in this deck, most runners will run remotes if they think they can get in. And early game, they can click to get in, making Melange less reliable. Celebrity Gift doesn't have that same issue and drawing it early is great, since it means you'll be threatening Heimdalls right away. And while revealing your hand isn't ideal, in this deck, it's not too much of an issue. Your opponent should know what to expect when they see HB:ST.

Eve Campaign: Once you get a bit of a money cushion, you will want to set up a server for Eve as soon as possible. In the age of Desperado, Whizzard, and Imp (not to mention Security Testing, as mentioned above), leaving an Eve unprotected is often times no longer viable and a waste. However, I've found that one single taxing ice, such as one of the Victors, can often be enough of an economic hit that many runners won't take that plunge to trash unless they are very well off. If they leave your Eve up, you are set for money for the rest of the game. Also, Eve doubles as a place to dump your credits for Account Siphon protection.

Enhanced Login Protocol: What a great card for HB:ST. If played early, it can be a real thorn in the runner's side for huge chunks of the game if they cannot find one of the 8 agendas in this deck. Combines well with everything.

Project Wotan: If you can score one early, you will be able to leverage it into a further scoring window.

Inazuma: This card is excellent and is one of your trump cards. Would love to include two of, but there simply isn't enough influence. A surprise Inazuma into ice that they thought they could break with clicks can be game changing (such as Heimdall or Ichi).

Other cards not included:

Caprice Nisei: I would absolutely love to include Caprice in this deck. An earlier iteration of this deck did indeed have her in. When you were all set up, she did incredible work, especially in combination with Enhanced Login Protocol. However, including her means sacrificing Celebrity Gift, thereby forcing you rely on Melange or other economic solutions such as Successful Demonstration. The problem with Caprice is when you're poor (which is not uncommon playing HB:ST), she really doesn't help as playing the Psi game becomes taxing for you - especially early game when every credit helps to rez ice. Overall, I just found that the consistency of getting big money from Celebrity outweighed Caprice's undoubted utility. And relying on a combination of Melange and Successful Demonstration is simply more inconsistent and dependent on the Runner's actions.

Overall, be prepared for long games where you win the war of attrition.

name: Headache 1.0
description:
Basically, Glacier up, all operation econ. Run the risk of Noise Milling agendas by not running Jacksons... but most likely just going to get ice which isn't too bad. Advance server should be upgraded with Awakening Center. Put more expensive ice on it, taxing ice in front. (Eli/NEXT/Viktor1.0) In front, Heimdall2.0/Janus/Ichi hosted on Awakening. Janus is sitll an 8 cost on Awakening, but you get the surprise factor and tons of braindamage if they spent clicks getting through Eli/Vik, and even get 1 brain damage guaranteed since they can't break all 4 subroutines.

Bonus points if you have an enhanced out. Fenris is for those facecheks, Bad pub doesn't really matter since we're not running NAPD.

Remember kids, Net Damage is temporary.

Brain Damage is forever.

name: Retired, But Connected.
description:
So, after thinking of how to make a deck for the ol' Spook. I figured that, I really wanted to keep his identity useful. That 2credits every turn that you're below on AP is killer.

So, I thought pretty hard about it and realized. Okay, so you want to start off slow and gain money, almost begging the opponent to score an agenda before you even run at a piece of ice. So this means you're effectively putting the game into mid-game immediately after the first turn. (first turn can still be used to facecheck ice and stuff, just to see and make the corp think.)

Now, what happens if I steal a bunch of 1 pointers or something? I thought, damn. I might be using a lot of creds to get in, and then not getting the bonus credits... So I thought back and realized that before-hand, I thought 'Data Dealer' was pretty terrible, like. Why would you ever want to forfeit and agenda for 9credits? Well, maybe if it's going to gain you 2 and it's not useful to you, then sure, try it!

Econ-heavy operations to beat traces (thank you based 1 link strength), and using 3 hostages to get Kati/Mr.Li/Inside Man out. Mr Li is probably first on the list for me to get out. I need some card draw. Then you can just start installing compromised employees, Data Dealers, and Decoys to get those beautiful ice credits from Comp Employee (and be able to beat traces better!).

Logos is perfect for the ol' spook. He wants to be down on agendas early, so using Logos can get you breakers or whatever you really want, it's the best tutor in the game for Good ol' Sterling. Of course I have 3 Special Orders also for getting Garrote/Corroder/Gordian or Yog out when needed.

It also finds a use for Mass Install other than a Noise Mill deck. That way I can install a bunch of these connections in 1 turn, then use my Calling In Favors for a huge amount of money. (I mean, even 4 is better than a Easy Mark!)

Some people might complain about Garrote, and if you do, you can run Femme instead, but I prefer the only 1 to boost the strength. It makes it a much better all-around Sentry breaker than Femme. Femme has the benefit of bypass and 1 less mem, but I'm not strapped for mem with this rig.

I really like the idea of using HQ Int and R&D Int for Multi-access. I should be fine on money to easily get these through and up and running.

How this plays: Best opening hand include Econ, Logos, Hostage, Any breaker, and Special Order. Best possible opening hand. You play your econ, run twice, HD and R&D, find out what ice they are using, and play Logos. Next turn, you grab what you need with hostage (Econ or card Draw or Hardware install), you can chose to install it right then for no click or not, but I'd say keep it in your hand if you're strapped on cash. (unless it's Kati then just put her out and click her), then pull out your Special Order, get the breaker you need.

Now here is where you can econ hard and get 2 breakers out. Chances are you will be able to break 66% of their breakers by having that breaker in hand first turn, and the breaker now.

So with this killer opening hand, you get your console out, your first connection, two of your breakers in hand, and you've already ran twice. In only two turns! But of course, that's just best-case scenario and you'll have to be flexible as always.

The biggest problem this deck would face is Program Destruction. Because, like.. literally there is no recursion. Once it's gone, it's gone.

I just wanted to try something different with a deck, This one isn't even in a physical copy yet, but I thought it might have some really good synergies with itself, so tell me what you think!

name: Nasir the Conquistador
Chaos Theory of the Overmind
Stirling: Ice Killer for Hire
